This chunk explains how to disable the exponential fog effect using the `clearFog()` or `clear_fog()` method, providing code examples in both Python and C++. This section follows the explanation of setting up exponential fog and demonstrates how to revert its application, ensuring users can dynamically adjust their scene's visual effects as needed.

The exponential fog effect can be turned off again using ~.NodePath.clear_fog():

python

render.clearFog()

cpp

render.clear_fog();
